column1: Incredible news today coming from Pfizer with their vaccine showing a 90% effectiveness rate. Thanks to #OperationWarpSpeed and tremendous dedication from scientists we have an extremely positive development in our fight against COVID.

Met with Martin and Amy Ramos at Thirsty Bird Bar & Kitchen in Charlotte to hear about the impact of COVID-19 on their family restaurant. Glad to hear they received assistance through the CARES Act. https://t.co/ZAxVgB6hhr

Appreciated the opportunity to visit Banas Lumber and Deb's Floral Designs in Monroe to hear how COVID-19 has impacted their stores. As we continue to rebuild our economy I remain committed to supporting our local small businesses and the workers they employ. https://t.co/ojwEX9esQ9

Had the opportunity to tour Meritt Products a family-owned manufacturer in Eaton County. During COVID-19 their carhop trays have been used to help maintain social distancing at everything from drive thru testing sites to local restaurants. https://t.co/vlCdEZoF5v

Visited @HillsdaleHosp today to discuss rural health care and the positive impact they received from the CARES Act and Paycheck Protection Program. Glad to hear they currently have zero patients admitted with COVID-19. https://t.co/Oxde5V1ZRD
Appreciated the opportunity to stop by Melling Tool in Jackson to hear about issues facing local workers and manufacturers as we combat COVID-19. https://t.co/DIaAnNtTAT
Throughout COVID-19 as a member of @EdLaborGOP I have made it a priority to listen to parents students and educators about the challenges facing schools as we combat the virus together.
If you have recovered from COVID-19 consider donating plasma and helping patients in the fight against this virus. https://t.co/2z2WFi2K0J

In communities across the 7th District the Paycheck Protection Program has made a significant difference supporting jobs and small businesses during COVID-19.  https://t.co/TuAoMq9crF https://t.co/kvbvviUQ75

Governor Whitmer's nursing home order is "an epic fail" — said a Michigan Democrat. Families in our state deserve answers for this failed policy that exposed vulnerable seniors to COVID-19.   Read my op-ed with @SteveScalise. ⬇️ https://t.co/7y6BwWNskp

Michigan’s nursing home policies have exposed vulnerable seniors to greater risk during COVID-19. At today’s @HouseCommerce hearing I asked @GovWhitmer about this misguided approach and the incomplete data reported by the state. https://t.co/ONA26hWumF
Thank you @realDonaldTrump for coming to Michigan today and supporting our dedicated front line workers in the fight against COVID-19. https://t.co/iIcUI6XJwW
Good news → Rural Health Clinics in Michigan are receiving over $9 million to expand COVID-19 testing in rural areas. https://t.co/SMz67gGXMk

Big news for Michigan farmers ➡️ Today @realDonaldTrump and @SecretarySonny unveiled the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program to provide relief during this pandemic.  Visit https://t.co/PvvgOtNwRd for more details. https://t.co/ctiCMkuvho
Much of Speaker Pelosi's $3 trillion wish list pre-dates COVID-19. This is about politics not emergency relief. Our communities deserve better. https://t.co/tPdusTDrNY

I am heading back to DC to vote NO and urge a different path forward. As policymakers we should be focused on bipartisan targeted COVID-19 relief instead of trying to exploit a pandemic for partisan gain.

Tomorrow the House is scheduled to vote on Speaker Pelosi’s 1800-page spending bill with a $3 trillion price tag. This laundry list of liberal policies that are unrelated to COVID-19 has no chance of becoming law.
Good news → Our local health centers in Jackson Lenawee and Monroe are receiving federal grants to expand their COVID-19 testing capabilities. https://t.co/QJE9To0mxr

A big thank you to all our nurses courageously on the front lines of the battle against COVID-19. We are grateful for the many sacrifices you make to keep our communities healthy. #NationalNursesDay https://t.co/SgIk4Fd3i5
As Michigan battles COVID-19 @realDonaldTrump and his Administration have been a strong partner in delivering resources to our state. Read more in @DetNewsOpinion. ⬇️ https://t.co/iG0AHjetfo

Held another tele-town hall today to share a number of available resources and consumer protection tips on avoiding Coronavirus scams. Visit https://t.co/l8Tgsi3Kn9 for more information. https://t.co/BDjEyXxBI8
Starting today a new Coronavirus testing site is opening up at the Rite Aid in Eaton Rapids. Follow the link for more details on the pre-registration process. ⬇️ https://t.co/kheFYAUw5k
More Coronavirus testing sites are opening up in Michigan including new drive-thru locations in Jackson and Lansing. ⬇️ https://t.co/r1YHxKsOEk

I am co-sponsoring the HEROES Act legislation from @RepHuizenga. As we fight the Coronavirus this is another important step we can take to support our first responders and health care professionals. https://t.co/h4MZQzQiwr

Just wrapped up another Coronavirus tele-townhall with constituents across the district. Lots of questions about the CARES Act and how it will help workers and small businesses. Learn more ➡️ https://t.co/1da4AEKCUz https://t.co/PIUNAp2f9M
More resources are coming to Michigan to help fight the Coronavirus.  https://t.co/R1mdfoOsC5
Today the House will be voting on the CARES Act to provide critical resources to Americans impacted by the Coronavirus. More details about the emergency relief ⬇️ https://t.co/1da4AEKCUz

I'm heading back to DC for the House vote tomorrow on the third Coronavirus response bill. The CARES Act will deliver emergency relief to Michigan workers small businesses and health care professionals. https://t.co/Y1hpxeyuZY

.@SpeakerPelosi & @SenSchumer what do items like wind/solar tax credits and airline emissions mandates have to do with addressing the Coronavirus? Partisan demands that are unrelated to the crisis at hand prevents critical relief from getting to those who need it most.
Wash your hands. Practice social distancing. Help other people. Together as Americans we will get through this and overcome the Coronavirus. #InItTogether https://t.co/IhYlFtsPRR

Today we also hosted a telephone town hall with constituents across the district to highlight available resources and answer questions about the Coronavirus. Visit https://t.co/l8Tgsi3Kn9 for more information. https://t.co/9UY0PBjnkL
IMPORTANT TAX UPDATE: The deadline has been extended to July 15 giving families and small businesses impacted by the Coronavirus more time to file their returns. https://t.co/hQaYThhlZN

.@realDonaldTrump just signed the Families First Coronavirus Response Act into law. It provides access to free testing and paid sick leave for workers who need it. Relief is on the way but there is much more work to do. We will get through this together.
Saddened to hear that Michigan lost our first resident from a case of the Coronavirus. My prayers are with his loved ones and everyone affected by this public health crisis. https://t.co/OWKQoBMksw
We are sending out regular Coronavirus email updates with available resources and public health guidance. Sign up here ⬇️ https://t.co/QBhZPd25PH
More than $15 million from the @CDCgov is on its way to help Michigan fight the Coronavirus. https://t.co/2KfZUOPAIF

For small businesses in Michigan impacted by the Coronavirus the @SBAgov has put together guidance to help navigate available resources.  More information is available here ➡️ https://t.co/h79O4yWlyG https://t.co/ZhBbF5GevL
Confronting the Coronavirus will take all of us as Americans doing our part. Follow the latest guidance to help limit the spread. https://t.co/lMVC1Duu4E
If you have questions or concerns about the Coronavirus @MichiganHHS has set up a statewide hotline at 1-888-535-6136. It is open all week from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. https://t.co/e8Be5LdXkj

Today I held conference calls to hear from county health departments and hospitals in the 7th District about their efforts to respond to the Coronavirus. Grateful for all the dedicated health professionals in our community. https://t.co/sHdi1YGAUJ
Starting yesterday Henry Ford Allegiance Health in Jackson is offering drive-though Coronavirus testing. More details here ⬇️ https://t.co/4Oapawb7uq

With my support the House passed the Families First Coronavirus Response Act which ensures free testing and lends a helping hand to workers and small businesses facing economic hardship. https://t.co/VnVOs1H1vD

.@realDonaldTrump took important action today by declaring a national emergency to combat the Coronavirus. The announcement of public-private partnerships to speed up testing capabilities is really welcome news. As Americans we will overcome this together.

Our mission remains serving residents of the 7th District while ensuring everyone’s health and safety. For the latest information about the Coronavirus and resources from CDC visit https://t.co/wyf23E9XGp and https://t.co/xBgTHVwpUg.

I am actively monitoring the real-time developments regarding the Coronavirus and its spread into Michigan. My staff and I have been in regular communication with federal state and local health officials and we stand ready to assist. https://t.co/G7PfAh4dAH

Thanks to everyone who attended our coffee hour yesterday at the Chelsea American Legion. I heard from constituents about a number of topics including the emergency funding package Congress passed last week to combat the Coronavirus. More info here ➡️ https://t.co/l8TgsilleH https://t.co/qzcEDwLn3d

The House just passed a bipartisan funding package to confront the Coronavirus and prevent its spread. We have to continue working together to keep our families and communities safe. https://t.co/cgOLLGJmBj
Attended another Coronavirus briefing with @VP Mike Pence and key public health officials to stay updated on the real time situation. https://t.co/nh4lXCfe5C

This week I attended three briefings on the Coronavirus including one this morning by top leaders of the multiple agencies handling this issue. They detailed the government-wide response effort currently underway to protect the health and safety of the American people.
